image.altText: A blonde man in a suit walking and being followed by a pack of reporters who are holding microhphones

props.synopsis: Former SA Liberal leader David Speirs crushed a "rock" of cocaine on his kitchen bench and supplied it to two men, including a man he knew was attending Narcotics Anonymous, a court document reveals.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader supplied drugs to Narcotics Anonymous attendee, court documents reveal

image.altText: A sun setting behind clouds at Lake Menindee in outback NSW.

props.synopsis: As a mass of water makes its way down from Queensland, the Menindee Lakes in outback New South Wales could be the beneficiary. Having slowly dried up for months, the fortunes of the bird and fish sanctuary may be about to change.

title.children: Up to 1 trillion litres of floodwater may hit outback's Menindee Lakes

image.altText: Willie Rioli holding a footy on field with other players

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide player Willie Rioli posted to social media to explain his "hatred" of the Hawks stems from his family's historical relationship with the club.

title.children: Willie Rioli's 'hatred' of Hawthorn outlined in deleted social media post

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in Adelaide

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has confirmed that if he is re-elected, his party will formally bid for South Australia to host a future International Climate Change Conference.

title.children: PM wants Australia to co-host 2026 UN climate conference

image.altText: A man holds a photo of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: An elderly man who fatally stabbed his wife to death at their suburban Adelaide home in December 2023 has died after being found mentally unfit to stand trial — but mentally competent at the time of the crime.

title.children: Francesco Dimasi, who fatally stabbed wife Maria, dies aged 93

image.altText: Cyclist Melissa Hoskins smiles during an interview.

props.synopsis: The mother of former Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins has told an Adelaide court she accepts her daughter's death was a "tragic accident".

title.children: Mum of Melissa Hoskins accepts fatal crash was 'tragic accident'

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride is facing multiple counts of assaulting a person known to him, after he was arrested and charged last week.

title.children: South Australian MP Nick McBride arrested and charged with assault

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman and a grey-haired man smile while standing next a tuna catch on a waterfront.

props.synopsis: Australian tuna producers are cheering after the industry received a sustainability certification following years of hard work.

title.children: World-first certification for once 'severely overfished' Australian tuna

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: A South Australian nurse has been reprimanded by South Australia's Civil and Administrative Tribunal after admitting to fabricating documents in a bid to gain employment.

title.children: SA nurse banned after committing 'serious' professional misconduct

image.altText: Two young girls with Port Adelaide guernseys and coloured face paint smile for a photo

props.synopsis: The magic of Gather Round can be hard to place, but on the ground in Adelaide the excitement of footy-loving youngsters is contagious and reminds us all why we fell in love with the game in the first place.

title.children: Gather Round gets its magic from recreating our childlike love of footy

image.altText: Three men sit on a couch with blue wall paper behind them

props.synopsis: Streaming may have increased distribution opportunities for emerging filmmakers, but with limited box office opportunities, is rags-to-riches-success a thing of the past?

title.children: Napoleon Dynamite and Mad Max are indi success stories. Can it still happen?

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing protective gloves holding a hot container with heated grass in it.

props.synopsis: In far west New South Wales, two Aboriginal men are drawing on the traditional knowledge of their ancestors to generate a source of income.

title.children: Aboriginal entrepreneurs harness ancient knowledge for new businesses

image.altText: Douglas Boyd conducting the Adelaide Symphony Orchestra in concert at the Adelaide Town Hall.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's culture of music has garnered global recognition, but some arts leaders say there's a missing piece of the puzzle.

title.children: 'A sore point': Adelaide's long wait for a purpose-built concert hall

image.altText: Wedges of blue cheese piled on a metal counter.

props.synopsis: Dairy farmers say the sector is struggling amid consumers turning to cheaper cheese imports flooding supermarket shelves.

title.children: Australians choosing cheaper imported cheese in cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Bob Katter reading a document in his office

props.synopsis: Herding Bob Katter is not an easy task for his long-suffering but loyal staff, who battle to keep him on message. But when he wanders, it can turn into viral gold.

title.children: Bob Katter's never lost for words, but there's one topic that's off limits

image.altText: Zak Butters flexes his muscles and pulls a funny face while Hawthorn players look disappointed

props.synopsis: The Port Adelaide-Hawthorn rivalry is very real, but also built on some rather odd foundations. In that sense, their Gather Round grand finale was more than fitting.

title.children: A silly rivalry gets a silly game as Port claims last Gather Round laugh

image.altText: A micro chip seen on a circuit board

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says new levies on semiconductor imports into the US will be announced in the coming week, with their "national security" impacts to be investigated.

title.children: Trump to impose new chip tariffs, including on electronics exempted days ago

image.altText: A yellow box which reads "Glad Wrap" in red

props.synopsis: The manufacturer of GLAD waste disposal and food storage bags, hit with $8.25 million federal penalty for making incorrect product recycling claims.

title.children: Clorox fined $8.25m over misleading 'ocean plastic' claims on GLAD bags

image.altText: a nsw police van next to the water during the search for a driver in the parramatta river

props.synopsis: Police divers have recovered the body of an 86-year-old man after he drove his car into the Parramatta River, hitting his elderly wife while she was standing on the riverbank.

title.children: Police recover man's body from Parramatta River after car plunged into water

image.altText: Two men dressed as Margaret Pomeranz and David Stratton

props.synopsis: In 2003, beloved film critic Margaret Pomeranz was arrested for trying to screen a banned film. More than 20 years later, the incident has inspired a comedy show.

title.children: In 2003, Margaret Pomeranz was arrested. That story is now a comedy show

image.altText: A man on a construction site wearing a blue sweater.

props.synopsis: Michael Norman Jessop, who will stand in the Brisbane electorate of Dickson, says he will fight what he describes as "trumped-up" charges, including stalking and weapons possession.

title.children: Trumpet of Patriots candidate facing criminal charges stands in Dutton's seat

image.altText: David Littleproud says Labor's Lisa Chester has "as much pull as a chihuahua"

props.synopsis: Bendigo MP Lisa Chesters has slammed "disrespectful" comments by Nationals leader David Littleproud and asked the party to rethink its language towards women.

title.children: Nationals leader compares Bendigo MP's political pull to a 'chihuahua'

image.altText: Rory McIlroy holds his head as the crowd celebrates behind him

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy has finally achieved golfing immortality in a modern masterpiece of sporting theatre, its flawed brilliance so relatable and so wonderfully symbolic of the Northern Irishman's career as a whole.

title.children: One of sport's greatest final-day battles ends with McIlroy's name in lights

image.altText: A person rides a motorbike with dust behind them as a white helicopter flies and follows nearby.,

props.synopsis: Some competitors are thousands of dollars out of pocket after the Gascoyne Dash in regional WA was cancelled, which organisers blame on the hospital being full.

title.children: Last-minute cancellation of desert racing event leaves riders furious

image.altText: a seated woman in a pink floral dress, smiling

props.synopsis: A Lockyer Valley man accused of killing his wife in a "murderous rage" allegedly staged the crime scene and sent text messages to himself to make it look like an accident, a court has heard.

title.children: Man allegedly staged wife's murder as lawnmower accident, court hears

image.altText: two men facing one another on a dark background one is red and one is blue

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are vying for your vote. Here’s what sets them apart.

title.children: What sets two of Australia's most powerful men apart from each other

image.altText: Picture of a long beach with a high oucrop at the end.

props.synopsis: The two men were pulled from the surf at Port Stephens. One could not be revived.

title.children: One dead, one critical after being pulled from surf north of Newcastle

image.altText: four politicians wearing high vis at a construction site

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says he wants to see house prices "steadily increase", as both leaders face questions over major policies targeting Australia's housing crisis.

title.children: Dutton says he wants house prices to 'steadily increase' in Australia

image.altText: Three primary school kids holding up small whiteboards and smiling

props.synopsis: One in three Australian students are failing to reach proficiency in maths, and according to a new report, many teachers lack the confidence to teach it.

title.children: 'Faddish' teaching practices blamed for Aussie kids' maths failures

image.altText: A graphic showing a calculator, maths symbols, a ruler and a hand holding a pen

props.synopsis: How are your maths skills? Have a crack at these questions for Year 8 students and see how you compare.

title.children: Can you pass Year 8 maths? Take this quiz to find out

image.altText: a man looks up at a wind turbine

props.synopsis: The Franz family moved to Diamondy, 280 kilometres north-west of Brisbane, for its tranquil nature, but now find themselves surrounded by looming towers.

title.children: Twelve of Australia's tallest wind turbines will surround retired couple's home

image.altText: Sleepbus founder Simon Rowe driving a bus at a fundraising event in Coffs Harbour.

props.synopsis: Residents who donated $100,000 for a sleeper bus for rough sleepers are outraged after being told it would be delivered to another community.

title.children: Residents furious after $100k homeless bus sent to different region

image.altText: A drone photo of a small ramp, with clear seas and lush greenery. The sky is blue.

props.synopsis: Marion Scrymgour has revealed the Northern Territory government and Commonwealth are a "long way" from resolving a funding dispute over the controversial Middle Arm industrial precinct outside of Darwin.

title.children: Federal MP casts doubt over future of billion-dollar Middle Arm project

image.altText: Donald Trump with his hand in the air as he disembarks a plane

props.synopsis: The details of President Donald Trump's most recent physical exam are revealed, with his doctor saying he is "fully fit" to serve.

title.children: Donald Trump 'fully fit' to serve as president, doctor says

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: In the world of Chinese social media, you don't have to look far to find them — posts encouraging people to join the Russian army are being circulated on accounts with tens of thousands of followers.

title.children: 'Real men are here': The posts luring Chinese men to join Putin's army
